resources:
Inspired
//Qoutes
"That brain of mine is something more than merely mortal; as time will show."
"The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it."
"Most of the good programmers do programming not because they expect to get paid or get adulation by the public, but because it is fun to program."
//Bios of programmers
Dennis MacAlistair Ritchie(September 9, 1941 – c. October 12, 2011)was an American computer scientist. He created the C programming language and, with long-time colleague Ken Thompson, the Unix operating system.
Augusta Ada King (10 December 1815 – 27 November 1852) was an English mathematician and writer, She was the first to recognise that the machine had applications beyond pure calculation.She is sometimes regarded as one of the first computer programmers.
Linus Benedict Torvalds (born December 28, 1969) is a Finnish–American software engineer who is the creator, and historically, the principal developer of the Linux kernel, which became the kernel for many Linux distributions and operating systems such as Android and Chrome OS.
